key_points: Erica Herman, Tiger Woods' girlfriend, has been a significant source of support for him following his car accident.
Herman was reported to have been by Woods' side constantly, providing emotional support.
Woods suffered severe leg injuries from a single-car accident on February 23 in Rolling Hills Estates and Rancho Palos Verdes, California.
He underwent emergency surgery for significant orthopedic injuries to his right lower extremity.
Woods was initially treated at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center before being transferred to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.
Dr. Anish Mahajan, Harbor-UCLA's chief medical officer, detailed the specifics of Woods' injuries.
The golfer acknowledged the support from fans and fellow golfers via Twitter.
Woods has two children, Sam and Charlie, with ex-wife Elin Nordegren, whom he divorced in 2010.
Lindsey Vonn, Woods' ex-girlfriend, also expressed her prayers for him following the accident.
Woods and Herman confirmed their relationship in November 2017, with Herman expressing optimism about the relationship's future.
spokespersons: Dr. Anish Mahajan (Chief Medical Officer and Interim CEO, Harbor-UCLA)
